intro: Premna procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate premna, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the rainy season. Premna procumbens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
